My team and I are sad to see Norristown, King of Prussia, and Bridgeport removed, yet delighted to continue to serve @MontcoPA and Berks Counties ‚Äî and welcome new people and communities.

The PA Supreme Court has chosen a final map, and I look forward to the work ahead. https://t.co/ARzYfUSvPf

¬†

While authorities continue to investigate the fire, I urge you to ensure that you have working smoke detectors.

My prayers are with the victim's family. https://t.co/pYot5z5NnC

We‚Äôve been clear that any Russian invasion into Ukraine must be met with swift and overwhelming repercussions.¬†
¬†
All diplomatic tools must be used to protect the sovereignty of Ukraine and its people.
Putin's decision to begin invasion attempts makes it clear it is time to enact crippling economic sanctions until Putin abides by international law, withdraws, and recognizes Ukraine‚Äôs sovereignty.

Saddened to hear of @RepHagedorn‚Äôs passing. 

My prayers are with his family, friends, and the people of Minnesota.

My classroom visits this week underscored what we already know ‚Äî students, teachers, and parents want to get back to normal.
¬†
We're nearing normalcy.

We must fight to get teachers more resources just as hard as we fought to get our children back in the classroom. https://t.co/zJ778sceyf

Inflation is being felt by nearly every family in our country ‚Äî and globally.
¬†
COVID-19 has done a number on our economy. In our recovery, high demand is¬†coupled with supply chain issues.

The housing crisis in our nation is only growing more dangerous ‚Äî as we‚Äôve seen with the recent tragedies in Philadelphia and New York City.

We must #ShowHousingLove because our housing crisis is a policy choice that we can fix only with the courage to act.

It‚Äôs been four years since 17 people‚Äîstudents and staff‚Äîwere murdered at Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland. 

Today, I‚Äôm thinking of them and praying for their families and school community who have found strength in their grief to inspire our nation to act on gun safety.

And at a time when adolescent suicide rates are on the rise, this step could save lives.

Today, I‚Äôll vote to pass the #EndForcedArbitration Act so that survivors of sexual assault and harassment are not blocked from seeking justice.

It‚Äôs about people, not profit.

As a member of Congress, I do not own any stocks ‚Äî and I believe that neither should my colleagues.

So, I‚Äôve signed onto two bills that will prohibit it.

Public service requires the public's trust ‚Äî one that we cannot break for profit.

To do our jobs, Congress members need the public‚Äôs trust.

We can‚Äôt maintain that trust if we are trading individual stocks ‚Äî which is why I signed onto the TRUST in Congress Act.

We must never forget, so that we never repeat ‚Äî May their memory be a blessing.

Our economy has felt the pains of the pandemic ‚Äî and so has our families.

Now, Republicans are asking the Supreme Court to gut life-saving clean air protections.

I'm joining my Democratic colleagues in asking SCOTUS to defend the #CleanAirAct to protect our Commonwealth.

Roe v. Wade has safeguarded reproductive rights for 49 years.

This cannot be the last anniversary.

We must pass the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act to ensure access to safe and legal abortions.

A woman‚Äôs freedom to make a private health decision is not the government‚Äôs business.

While tensions have risen in recent days, one thing must be clear: 

The United States stands with the Ukrainian people and any movement of Russian troops or their proxies into Ukraine must be met with a swift and overwhelming repercussions.

Calling on the ‚Äúworld‚Äôs greatest deliberative body‚Äù to remove the filibuster to actually deliberate voting rights is not a radical position.
